title: Where I Was When I Heard...
name: Where I Was When I Heard...
description:
A Map by Deisnor

Songs that are forever linked to Places

properties.name: Crawlspace Artist Residency Former Home 1994
properties.description: Posted by Trygger   Approximate location in an old textile fabriek on the lijnbaansgracht. My project at 22.

properties.name: Dee-Lite
properties.description: Posted by DeisnorAvenue B, New YorkWhen I first moved to New York, I suffered from drastic exposure to subcultures of all kinds. I happened to meet a roving group of models while in line for The Palace. They helped us move swiftly passed the doormen and then gave us a tour of the East Village while still singing Groove Is In the Heart. I thought the East Village was exotic. I thought Deelite was exotic. I guess it was easy then to be enraptured by everyone around you when you only heard The Steve Miller Band and Elvis prior and knew people who organized parties at the VFW. I\'m still intrigued by everyone around me but I don\'t pine for Deelite, gogoboots or models very much.

properties.name: Dj Masavo's Sensual Goddess
properties.description: Posted by Deisnor 2347 NW Kearney Street, Portland, ORAn essential part of the Eastern mix which moved us from Amsterdam to Portland. The celebratory rythms of Indian Tribal Belly Dance music were the perfect aural transition to a new city, with a new baby and a new start-up in our first house. It also matched the fountains I started collecting. Here\'s what one website says about this music "Awaken the sacred dancer within your soul! DJ Mosavo channels the age old mysteries of feminine power with a unique fusion of traditional ethnic music and contemporary grooves CD that is as super charged as it is celestial!" Argghhh. Not the picture I had in my mind.

properties.name: Former Home Early 70s
properties.description: Posted by Trygger bartlett terrace, brockton, maWhere I saw my mom crying about the death of Elvis and jumped out of windows onto old mattresses and thought older boys were gross for making forts so they could look at porn. And most importantly got my first albums which included Shawn Cassidy, Blondie, Planet Rock and The Message/Grand Master Flash and The Furious Five. Still the music that this place really inspires is REO Speedwagon.

properties.name: Hotel California @ the 3rd Street Promenade Santa Monica, CA
properties.description: Posted by Designingmama 1351 3rd Street Promenade, Santa Monica, CAStrolling down the Promenade one hot summer night, I swear I thought that THE EAGLES were serenading me live. It was a man, with his 5-year-old daughter backing him up, singing like angels. 9 years later, I am propelled back to that sidewalk when I hear HOTEL CALIFORNIA.

properties.name: Hotel Di-Ann
properties.description: Posted by Deisnor I stayed here when I first arrived in Amsterdam January 1994. We became friends and when I left, my name stayed behind. Thanks guys. While still a budget hotel, it is significantly nicer now. Stay there, eat candy, say hi!

properties.name: Krush Groove Addiction Started Around Here
properties.description: Posted by Trygger cohannet street, taunton, maMy 6th grade best friend introduce me to Krush Groove. I bought the album and listened to it about 10 times before school everyday.

properties.name: Maceo Parker
properties.description: Posted by Bdolan2000I stumbled into this show -- nominally at scullers, but really in a hotel ballroom -- and was blown away by the sheer funkiness of it, and the intense road-honed showmanship of maceo and his band...

properties.name: Me'Shell Ndegocello
properties.description: Posted by DeisnorAl GreenTrio of conceptual artists and their collective identity and bar, Seymour Likely, is forever etched with Me\'Shell Ndegocello

properties.name: Old Eisnor Offices
properties.description: Posted by Janedoe 200 Varick Street, New York, NY

properties.name: Orbital
properties.description: Posted by Bdolan2000hanover, nhDuring a long, long, night in the fall of 1994, my mind was forever opened to the world of electronic music when a friend slipped on an orbital album.

properties.name: Overplayed Jazzmatazz
properties.description: Posted by DeisnorEast 11th Street, New York, NYIt was the perfect mood music for late night lounging or sunday morning brunches which we hosted every week for our neighborhood of Tokyo transplants, Japanophiles, a motley bunch of amateur DJs from Europe and the Midwest and straight drag queens. Who knew that I would date him for a minute the following the year.

properties.name: Philip Glass
properties.description: Posted by Jason Yosemite Took myself backpacking for my birthday c. 1994. Bears in my camp, ice on the ground, solitude and some philip glass cassette tape that I had found.

properties.name: Roxanne Roxanne Mini Market  (previously)
properties.description: Posted by Jasonne fremont st & 15th ave, portlandDuring the height of that song\'s popularity, this mini market claimed the title for itself. I never really went in, cause it was mostly selling 40ozs to tough older kids, so I can\'t even speculate if they played the song non-stop or what. I hope someone out there has a photo of this classic Place.

properties.name: Supersonic
properties.description: Posted by Trygger attleboro, maSomewhere in this town I held my third job (at the age of 16); A barista in an under 21 club. My buddy the spandex clad, mafia inspired DJ would spin Supersonic toward then of everynight and I would get all jittery and excited. I knew all the words. It was here where I also drove a ferari. The one owned by my boss who I briefly dated.

properties.name: The Easton House
properties.description: Posted by Jason Northern European Influences

properties.name: The Suburban Roots of HipHop
properties.description: Posted by DeisnorStarted from my pink stereo on which I "learned" to scratch to beats like Roxanne Roxanne and "They call us Whistle and this is true. We love to do the things we\'re not supposed to do. We don\'t mean robbin stealin or muggin. In fact we take it seriously, we\'re only buggin". Both of whch I got to hear for the first time from the Brown University College Station on Saturday mornings.

properties.name: The breakbeats and scratches of DJ Krush (and voice of Esthero)
properties.description: Posted by Baostar Enterprise and Aliso Creek Rd, Aliso Viejo, CADriving around Aliso Viejo with the dev team at buy.com (circa 2000), looking for a place to drink and not worry about code. One of my buddy is really into Japanese bands, so I played DJ Krush and Dragon Ash for the first time while we look for a parking spot. "Final Home" was the first tune that got me into DJ Krush; "Skin Against Skin" is super-nice too.

properties.name: They Might Be Giants - The Statue Got Me High
properties.description: Posted by Bdolan2000It did.

properties.name: W Hotel and Pants for Joan Jett
properties.description: Posted by Deisnor 120 East 39th Street, New York, NY, 10016It was the bubbble era in NY and we had a retreat for folks from all three of our offices at the W Hotel Tuscany. That evening we were going to see the Joan Jett concert. I tested the W Hotel\'s famed Whatever Whenever button on their phones by asking someone to buy me pleather pants for the show at Patricia Field\'s. They did it! It was just an experiment but they pulled it off and fulfilled on what I thought was an overtthetop impossible to deliver on promise. Joan Jett rocked!
